name: Researchskills
tagline: Lecture notes for research skills course
body:
### General infos This site contains material and links for the MSc course Research Skills. The **objective** of this MSc course is to to learn discipline-independent skills for doing quantitative research at the graduate-level. Content includes _Introduction to philosophy and history of science, scientific method, finding your question, design of experiments, ensuring reproducibility, data analysis in R, visualization, introduction to LaTeX, scientific writing, logic and clarity, scientific presentations, good scientific practice_ ### Important links for participants * [Syllabus](https://github.com/florianhartig/ResearchSkills/blob/master/Syllabus/Syllabus2014.pdf?raw=true) / timetable for the course * [Campus online](https://www.verwaltung.uni-freiburg.de/lsfserver/rds?state=verpublish&status=init&vmfile=no&publishid=138902&moduleCall=webInfo&publishConfFile=webInfo&publishSubDir=veranstaltung) * Ilias page - course material will be posted here Questions / contact: [Florian Hartig](http://www.biom.uni-freiburg.de/mitarbeiter/hartig) ### Materials and further readings * Lecture notes will be available soon * R / Stats: tutorial, [code](https://github.com/florianhartig/ResearchSkills/tree/master/Labs/R/ExampleCode), [stats help website](http://biometry.github.io/APES/) (experimental) * LaTex: [tutorial](https://github.com/florianhartig/ResearchSkills/raw/master/Labs/LaTeX/LatexHowTo/how_to_latex.pdf), [code](https://github.com/florianhartig/ResearchSkills/tree/master/Labs/LaTeX/example) ### Authors and copyright Unless specified otherwise, the author of these materials is Florian Hartig.
